entities.description: "Smith et al. (2017) proposed an approach to learn orthogonal transformations for word embeddings of multiple languages."
"Johnson et al., 2016 conducted research on pre-training in multilingual translation systems."
"Firat et al., 2016 also researched the use of additional data from another language to improve NMT."
"Corbett and Comrie, 2003 provided information on the mutual intelligibility of Belarusian and Russian languages."
"Table 4 presents data on the correlation between word embedding alignment and BLEU score in bilingual translation tasks."
"Table 5 shows the effect of pre-training on multilingual translation into English, with different language systems."
"Table 6 provides example translations from GL to EN, highlighting the impact of pre-training on capturing rarer vocabulary and grammatical structure."
"Table 7 displays the top 10 n-grams that one system did a better job of producing, comparing bilingual and multilingual models."
"Figure 2 shows the f-measure of target words in the bilingual translation task PT to EN, demonstrating the impact of pre-training on accuracy."
"NMT refers to Neural Machine Translation, the focus of the research discussed in the text."
"BLEU score is a metric used to evaluate the quality of machine translation."
"bi refers to a bilingual system trained on only the eval source language."
"multi-lingual systems are trained on two similar source languages."
"GL/PT represents the language pair of Galician to Portuguese, noted for their high similarity."
"BE/RU represents the language pair of Belarusian to Russian, noted for their low similarity."
"English is the target language in the multilingual translation tasks discussed."
"Belarusian is one of the languages in the study, particularly in the context of its similarity to Russian."
"Russian is one of the languages in the study, particularly in comparison to Belarusian."
"Galician is one of the languages in the study, particularly in the context of its similarity to Portuguese."
"Portuguese is one of the languages in the study, particularly in the context of its similarity to Galician."
"Pre-trained embeddings refer to the use of word embeddings that have been trained prior to being used in a specific task."
"Low-resource languages are languages with limited available data for training translation models."
"Higher-resource languages are languages with more available data for training translation models."
"An encoder is a component in the NMT system that processes the input language."
"A decoder is a component in the NMT system that generates the output language."
"Semantically separate space refers to the distinct representation of different languages in vector space."
"Vector spaces are used to represent word embeddings in a multi-dimensional space."
"Function words are words that typically do not carry meaning on their own but serve a grammatical purpose."
"N-grams are contiguous sequences of n items from a given sample of text or speech."
"F-measure is a measure of a test's accuracy, specifically in the context of machine learning and information retrieval."
"PT is an abbreviation for Portuguese, used in the context of the translation task."

relationships.description: "Smith et al. (2017)'s approach is used to analyze the data presented in Table 4."
"Johnson et al., 2016's research is referenced to explain the findings in Table 5."
"Firat et al., 2016's research is used to understand the effects shown in Table 5."
"Corbett and Comrie, 2003's findings on language similarity are used to interpret the results in Table 5."
"The results in Table 4 are compared and contrasted with the findings in Table 5."
"The translations in Table 6 are analyzed further in the context of n-grams in Table 7."
"The n-gram analysis in Table 7 is related to the f-measure results displayed in Figure 2."
"NMT systems can benefit from pre-trained embeddings, as discussed in the text."
"BLEU score is used to evaluate the performance of NMT systems."

entities.description: "ov et al., 2017 refers to a group or organization that has incorporated character-level, phrase-level, and positional information of words and trained models using the CBOW algorithm."
"Mikolov et al., 2013 is the group credited with developing the CBOW algorithm, which is used for training word embeddings."
"Glorot and Bengio (2010) refers to the authors who proposed the uniform initialization method used in baseline models without pre-training."
"Neishi et al., 2017 is a group that has conducted work on using pre-trained embeddings in NMT, supporting the efficacy of pre-training."
"Artetxe et al., 2017 is another group that has contributed to the body of work on the use of pre-trained embeddings in NMT."
"Gangi and Federico, 2017 are authors who have also explored the use of pre-trained embeddings in the field of NMT."
"Smith et al., 2017 proposed an approach to learn orthogonal transformations for aligning word embeddings of multiple languages into a single space."
"The CBOW algorithm is an event in the process of training word embeddings, as developed by Mikolov et al., 2013."
"BLEU score is an evaluation metric used to assess the quality of machine translation, referenced in the context of pre-trained word embeddings' efficacy."
"NMT stands for Neural Machine Translation, a concept central to the discussion of pre-trained embeddings and their impact on translation quality."
"AZ refers to Azerbaijan, a geo-political entity that is part of the low-resource languages discussed in the context of pre-training word embeddings."
"BE refers to Belarus, another geo-political entity that is categorized as a low-resource language in the study."
"GL refers to Galician, a language that showed significant gains in BLEU scores with pre-trained word embeddings, indicating its status as a low-resource language."
"ES refers to Spanish, a language used in the study to examine the effect of linguistic similarity on the efficacy of pre-trained embeddings."
"FR refers to French, a language included in the study to investigate the impact of linguistic similarity on pre-trained embeddings."
"IT refers to Italian, another language used in the research to explore the effects of linguistic similarity on pre-training embeddings."
"RU refers to Russian, a language that showed larger accuracy gains from pre-training, highlighting its dissimilarity to the target language Portuguese."
"HE refers to Hebrew, a language that also demonstrated significant gains from pre-training, likely due to its low baseline BLEU scores."
"Portuguese is the target language used in the study to investigate the effect of linguistic similarity on pre-trained embeddings."
"Indo-European is the largest language family from which source languages were selected for the study on linguistic similarity and pre-training."
"Romance is a sub-family of the Indo-European language family, used in the study to select source languages based on linguistic similarity to Portuguese."
"Western Romance is another sub-family of the Romance language family, relevant to the selection of source languages in the study."
"West-Iberian is the most specific language family considered in the study, focusing on the linguistic similarity to Portuguese."

relationships.description: "ov et al., 2017 utilizes the CBOW algorithm developed by Mikolov et al., 2013 for training word embeddings."
"ov et al., 2017 provides additional experimental evidence supporting the findings of Neishi et al., 2017 on the use of pre-trained embeddings in NMT."
"ov et al., 2017 examines the efficacy of pre-trained word embeddings, aligning with the work of Artetxe et al., 2017 on the same topic."
"ov et al., 2017 builds upon the work of Gangi and Federico, 2017 by examining the usefulness of pre-training across various language pairs."
"ov et al., 2017 compares their model initialization using pre-trained word vectors to the uniform initialization method proposed by Glorot and Bengio (2010)."
"ov et al., 2017 tests the hypothesis regarding word embedding alignment by adopting the approach proposed by Smith et al., 2017."

"Wu et al. are referenced for their observations on the less common use of pre-training in NMT."

"Ramachandran et al. are referenced for their work on methods for using monolingual data in NMT systems."

"Gangi and Federico are referenced for their work on learning translation lexicons in an unsupervised manner."
